Awards & Press

Awards

2019 : Best M. Tech Student

Pooja Ravi Kulkarni is selected for the Computer Science of India Society Bangalore Medal for Best M.Tech Student 2018.

Advised by Prof. Chiranjib Bhattacharyya

Dec 2018 : Google PhD Fellowship

Shikhar Vashishth is awarded Google PhD Fellowship.

Advised by Prof. Partha Talukdar and Prof. Chiranjib Bhattacharyya

Aug 2018 : Best M. Tech Student

Abhishek Bansal received the Computer Science of India Society Bangalore Medal for Best M.Tech Student, 2017.

Advised by Prof. Chiranjib Bhattacharyya

2015 : Best Student Paper Award

Paper Titled “Translation Induction on Indian Language Corpora using Translingual Themes from Other Languages” in CICLing 2015 got Best Student Paper Award.

Goutham Tholpadi, Chiranjib Bhattacharyya, Shirish Shevade

2011 : Best Paper Award

Paper Titled “Exploiting Coherence in Reviews for Discovering Latent Facets and Associated Sentiments” in SDM,2011 got Best Paper Award.

Himabindu Lakkaraju, Chiranjib Bhattacharyya, Indrajit Bhattacharya, Srujana Merugu

2009 : Runner-Up Award

Paper Titled “Interval Data Classification under Partial Information - A Chance-Constraint Approach” in PAKDD, 2009 got Runner-Up Award.

Sahely Bhadra , J. Saketha Nath , Aharon Ben-Tal and Chiranjib Bhattacharyya

2006 : KDD Cup 2006 Best Student Submission

KDD Cup 2006 Best Student Submission, PE Identification Task.

Karthik Kumara , Sourangshu Bhattacharya, Mehul Parsana, Shivramkrishnan K, Rashmin Babaria, Saketha Nath J, and Chiranjib Bhattacharyya

 

Press

May 12 2020 : Sealing areas with higher Covid-19 cases or 2-day work week with lockdown can contain virus, shorten epidemic duration: Analysis

Lockdowns, though an effective policy for containment, imposes a heavy cost on the economy as it enforces extreme social distancing measures on the whole population. Unemployment is an inevitable outcome of economic downturn and lockdowns have resulted in significant job losses

The 18-member task group is co-chaired by Chiranjib Bhattacharya, professor, Department of Computer Science and Automation, Indian Institute of Science and Venkatesh Valluri, chairman and president of Ingersoll Rand (India Region).
